metadata.title: CVE-2014-8080 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The REXML parser in Ruby 1.9.x before 1.9.3-p550, 2.0.x before 2.0.0-p594,and 2.1.x before 2.1.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(memory consumption) via a crafted XML document, aka an XML EntityExpansion (XEE) attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8080` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.1
libtcltk-ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.1
ri1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.1
ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.1
ruby1.9.1-examples - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.1
ruby1.9.1-full - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.1
ruby1.9.3 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

libruby2.0 - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.1
ruby2.0 - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.1
ruby2.0-tcltk - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby1.9.1 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.1').
ruby2.0 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.1').
